page.title: 07BRECHIN CATHEDRAL
page.content: {Brechin Cathedral}is over{750}years old and next to it stands the even older 10th century{Round Tower, originally built as a defensive point by{Celtic}monks. Both buildings are of local{Old Red Sandstone}and are the best known buildings in the town. The present minister estimated that some{6000}people visit each year making the buildings a major tourist attraction. Visits are made by Britons and tourists from Europe, North America and Australia. Most are interested in the ancient relics in the cathedral. These include silver goblets of Viking age, communion trays and an early Christian {Standing Stone.} The stained glass windows, depicting scenes from the Bible, are another major attraction.
